ok, if you want to do mine then go for it though I might want to change it when I get the time to make it my self

oh and did I do the DV calculations right?

Except through the intakes on either side of the tube.

Already tried that. The intakes are decoys. There's armour behind them. The only way to kill the Mk IV is with more than one shot to the same area.

Already tried that. The intakes are decoys. There's armour behind them. The only way to kill the Mk VI is with more than one shot to the same area.

I havent tested it yet but im sure you can ram a missile in the back to take out the engines. It most likely wont kill it but is should disable it.

Needless to say I think we are entering a new era of KSP space combat.

I havent tested it yet but im sure you can ram a missile in the back to take out the engines. It most likely wont kill it but is should disable it.

Needless to say I think we are entering a new era of KSP space combat.

I managed to get a lucky shot at the engines at just the right angle and knock all of them off, but it still had its weapons and multiple command pods.

Already tried that. The intakes are decoys. There's armour behind them. The only way to kill the Mk IV is with more than one shot to the same area.

Nope.Give me a sec.

I managed to get a lucky shot at the engines at just the right angle and knock all of them off, but it still had its weapons and multiple command pods.

the question is where is the original core? I remember getting a hit one time and it stated that that there was no target (indicating a kill)

After that the main ship was designated a lander

sense the rules state it must be the original core for it be considered alive that should count as a one hit kill

Even so if the engines are taken out that should at least disable it, rendering it un-useable but still alive.
That's the strongest spot. It's where plates are overlapped.

That's the strongest spot. It's where plates are overlapped.

engines or intakes?
Intakes. I'm telling you. They're decoys.

I just tested my theory and I was right. Hitting the backside square on is a one hit kill due to the fact the the original core is destroyed.

Pics later

Take 2 was a one hit.

Take three took everything on board(I wasn't paying much attention)

(an old rivalry sent on very different paths)

Needless to say I think we are entering a new era of KSP space combat.

Yes, i'd say the new Zokesia Armor Type ships are 10 times better armored than their predecessors. (and the Salvation Mk II is one of them)
I just hope yall are ready for a new surprise (zeke already knows whats in store)
